original: Molander, Nils Halvarsson, förste marinläkare, Karlskrona, f. 23/7/94 i Västerås av gros’shandl. Halvar M. o. Els’a Sofia Tidholm.^ G. 20 m. Edith Margit Gabrielia Krumlinde. Barn : Kerstin f. 21, d. 36, Marianne 22, Elsa-Brita 24, Jan 25, Stellan 28. — Stud:-ex. 12, med. kand. 15 o. med. lic. 20, allt i Sthlm. E. läk. v. Kristinehamns hosp. 16-17, und :läk. v. Karlskrona las. 19-20, v. Österåsens sanat. 20, und :läk. o. förste und :läk. v. Karlskrona las. 21-25, kort. föror dn. s. prov:’läk. i Karlskrona distr. 27 o. 28. Marinläk ::stip. 18, marinläk. av andra gr. 20, av första gr. i Mlk 22, v. Mlk 25, förste marinläk. v. Mlk samt för- ste ’läk. v. Karlskrona örlogsstat. 30, kommend. isom fartygsläk. femton mån. Led. av Karlskrona hälsovmd fr. 31, ’led. av -direkt, f. länslas. i Karlskrona. RNO, RVO, LÖS.
translated:
Molander, Nils Halvarsson, first naval doctor, Karlskrona, born on July 23rd, 1894 in Västerås to merchant Halvar M. and Els'a Sofia Tidholm. Married on the 20th to Edith Margit Gabrielia Krumlinde. Children: Kerstin born in 1921, died in 1936, Marianne in 1922, Elsa-Brita in 1924, Jan in 1925, Stellan in 1928. Studied at Stockholm University, received degree in 1912, medical candidate in 1915, and medical license in 1920. Worked as an assistant doctor at Kristinehamns Hospital from 1916 to 1917, deputy doctor at Karlskrona Hospital from 1919 to 1920, at Österåsen Sanatorium in 1920, and as deputy doctor and first deputy doctor at Karlskrona Hospital from 1921 to 1925. Also served as a substitute doctor in the Karlskrona district in 1927 and 1928. Became a naval doctor grantee in 1918, naval doctor of the second degree in 1920, of the first degree in 1922, stationed in Malmö in 1925, and became the first naval doctor of the Malmö Naval Station and the first doctor at the Karlskrona Naval Base in 1930. Commanded as ship doctor for fifteen months. Member of the Karlskrona Health Board since 1931 and member of the board of directors for the county hospital in Karlskrona. Recipient of the Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, and Royal Red cross. 

Note: LÖS stands for Order of the Polar Star.
